## Q1

```{r, setup}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false

library(webexercises)

# Randomized parameters for future firm values
value_low <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 100, sd = 3), 0)
value_mid <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 150, sd = 3), 0)
value_high <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 191, sd = 3), 0)

# Risk-free rate
rf <- 0.05

# Probability (equally likely outcomes)
prob <- 1/3

# Expected future value
expected_future_value <- prob * (value_low + value_mid + value_high)

# Present value (firm value today under perfect capital markets)
present_value <- expected_future_value / (1 + rf)


```

**Q1**: Assuming that in the event of default, 20% of Monsters Incorporatedâ€™s (MI) asset value is lost to bankruptcy costs, what is the initial value of MI as an all-equity (unlevered) firm (in million dollars)? `r fitb(round(present_value, 0), tol = 1)`

Answer: `r round(present_value, 0)` million dollars
